intro: Grewia pindanica, commonly known as the Pindan grewia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. Grewia pindanica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native range.
